title: Delhiites Feel Suffocated As Delhi's Air Quality Drops To 'Very Poor' And Diwali Is Yet To Come
text:
Delhiites Feel Suffocated As Delhi's Air Quality Drops To 'Very Poor' And Diwali Is Yet To Come

Delhiites Feel Suffocated As Delhi's Air Quality Drops To 'Very Poor' And Diwali Is Yet To Come

Only a few weeks back, Delhiites were cheering the city's clear weather but in no time it has gotten worse. The Air Quality Index (AQI) has been rising on a daily basis. Dust and smog continued to envelop Delhi as the AQI fell to the 'very poor' category.

In its advisory, the Center-run System of Air Quality and Weather Forecasting And Research (SAFAR) have advised people of the sensitive category to avoid morning walks and any other outdoor activities.

An increase in the menace of air pollution in the national capital has resulted in a spike in respiratory problems and cough and eye irritation among adults.

afp/representational image

"The pollution has increased in the past three days. I am feeling very suffocated. There is so much haze everywhere. I will soon start wearing an anti-pollution mask during morning walks. The government must do something to combat the air pollution in the capital," said Ravinder Kumar, a local while speaking to ANI.

Another local named Ram Kumar Sharma also narrated his ordeal and said that he is feeling breathless and suffocated due to the dust pollutants in the air. "Even in the morning also, the air is not clean. In winter also, the situation will become worse. There is a dire need to take requisite measures."

bccl/representational image

Today, the overall AQI in Delhi was 312 at around 8:30 in the morning.

The AQI between 0 to 50 is considered 'good', 51 and 100 falls under the category of 'satisfactory', 101-200 is marked as 'moderate', 201 to 300 'poor', 301 to 400 'very poor' and 500 and beyond is considered 'severe'.

Overcast skies prevailed in the city with the minimum and the maximum temperature hovering at 20 degrees Celsius and 33 degrees Celsius respectively.

(With ANI Inputs)
